page.title: 01INTRODUCTION
page.content: The village of Bishop Monkton is pretty all the year round. A small beck rises above the village and meanders through it under many small bridges.Flowering trees,spring bulbs and the Church lytch gate astride the stream make an attractive picture.The houses in the centre of the village are up to 200 years old. Most of the area is farmland which falls gently to the Ure valley.Along the river there is an abundance of flora and fauna (including herons),and in the winter the North bank is home for several species of migrating geese.There are two locks used daily by leisure boats.Several fishing clubs are active in the area.Newby Hall is a stately 18th century house open to visitors.
